instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when  trackpad is connected
threads.message: hello guys , I have this machine that  would wouldn't b.oot dot desktop only when I connect the trackpad, but with the trackpad disconnected , it boots okay . I have measured for a short to ground on J4801 but I could not find any , I also tried to boot the machine through safe mode , but still unable to . I have replaced a whole functional top casing that includes the trackpad and cable but no changes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when  trackpad is connected
threads.message:
Try desoldering F4809.
If still the same, try removing L4803.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when  trackpad is connected
threads.message: With L4803 removed, the machine boots okay , but trackpad is not working since there's no power going to it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when  trackpad is connected
threads.message:
Resolder L4803 and post diode mode to ground w/ and w/o trackpad connected.
Inspect J4801 pins for corrosion.

Also connect trackpad and try disconnecting keyboard only.
Check if <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> is always high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when  trackpad is connected
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> restarts when  trackpad is connected
threads.message: Thank you for your time and apologies for dragging  you over my  mistakes . The issue was the charger I was using , the charger is an after market charger , while the battery for the client is completely bad . So the machine is unable to solely operate on the charger power only . its been resolved now
